text:
The first trailer for the new "Invisible Man" with Elizabeth Moss
07 Nov 2019, 18:45 by Daria Gromova
The restart of the famous horror will be released on large screens in the spring.
Universal Pictures has published the first trailer for the horror film "The Invisible Man." This is a restart of the 1933 film of the same name based on the novel by Herbert Wells.



Cecilia Cass is the main character who, after the death of Hadrian, an abusive ex-boyfriend, is trying to start a new life. But strange events make her believe that the guy is not dead at all, as it seemed before - only no one believes her.
Work on the film began back in 2007. In the process, the project changed scriptwriters, studios and concepts, at one time Johnny Depp was to appear in the film. As a result, Lee Wonnell became the director and screenwriter (he worked on the Saw and Astral series). The main roles were played by Elizabeth Moss ("Mad Men", "The Handmaid's Tale") and Oliver Jackson-Cohen ("Faster than a Bullet", the series "Dracula").
The premiere of the film in Russia will take place on March 26, 2020.
